issue.title: Fail to create render window with a native handle on Linux
issue.body:
As discussed with Tank on IRC:

This could, of course, be the fault of a third party library but:

OS: Ubuntu 15.10 64bit, Compiler: gcc 5, SFML 2.3.2
Using the [nana UI library](https://github.com/cnjinhao/nana) trying to create a control with a render window attached fails with:

X Error of failed request:  BadAccess (attempt to access private resource denied)
  Major opcode of failed request:  2 (X_ChangeWindowAttributes)
  Serial number of failed request:  61
  Current serial number in output stream:  69
terminate called without an active exception
Aborted (core dumped)

#29 0x7512f2    MainWindow::MainWindow()::{lambda()#1}::operator()() const() (/home/captain/bgrll/bgrll/src/MainWindow.cpp:49)

The following can be used to reproduce the problem:

```
#include <nana/gui/wvl.hpp>
#include <SFML/Graphics/RenderWindow.hpp>

int main()
{   
    nana::form form;

    sf::RenderWindow rw;
    rw.create(reinterpret_cast<sf::WindowHandle>(form.native_handle()));

    form.events().destroy([&rw]() { rw.close(); });
    form.events().focus([&rw]() {rw.clear(sf::Color(50, 60, 50)); rw.display(); });

    form.show();
    nana::exec();

    return 0;
}
```

The above works fine on Windows using VS2015 (as does my actual use case).

Possibly related is the X11 example which builds and runs, but closing the window leaves the SFML windows behind:
![](http://djfallen.com/images/x11.png)

issue.title: `SoundEffects.cpp` example segfaults due to channel count mismatch
issue.body:
### Prerequisite Checklist

- [X] I searched for [existing issues](https://github.com/search?q=repo%3ASFML%2FSFML&type=issues) to prevent duplicates
- [X] I searched for [existing discussions on the forum](https://www.google.com/search?q=site%3Ahttps%3A%2F%2Fen.sfml-dev.org) to prevent duplicates
- [X] I am here to report an issue and not to just ask a question or look for help (use the [forum](https://en.sfml-dev.org/forums/index.php#c3) or [Discord](https://discord.gg/nr4X7Fh) instead)

### Describe your issue here

The `SoundEffects.cpp` example segfaults on my machine, with invalid accesses at these lines. It seems like, in the first case, there is a mismatch in the size of `filters` (which is `music.getChannelCount()`) and the index `channel` (which goes up to `frameChannelCount`). 

In my machine, `music.getChannelCount() == 2` and `frameChannelCount == 8`.

```cpp
// L926
    outputFrames[channel] = *enabled ? filters[channel](input) : input;
//                                     ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

// L770
    outputFrames[channel] = *enabled ? yn : xn;
//  ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
```
